specimens.label: CERVIX, BIOPSY
diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma.

gross_description.label: Specimen #1 is received in formalin in a container labeled with the patient's name, medical record number, \
per the requisition
gross_description.description: an aggregate of tan white-pink irregularly-shaped tissue fragments (2.6 x 1.8 x 1.0 cm). The specimen is serially sectioned and submitted entirely in biopsy bags in 1A - 1B.

specimens.microscopic_description: The sections show three fragments of atypical squamous epithelium that are admixed with abundant acute neutrophilic exudate and superficial squamous debris. The intact fragments consist of proliferation of markedly atypical squamous non-keratinizing squamous epithelium. The nuclei are large with abundant cytoplasm. Atypical mitotic figures are frequently present. In one fragment there is underlying stroma present and irregular fingers of atypical neoplastic squamous epithelium is seen extending into the stroma.
specimens.additional_notes: Dr. Shenoy has reviewed the slides and concurs. 28yo with suspected cervical cancer

gross_description.description: an intact, unoriented cervical cone (1.7 x 1.6 x 0.4 cm) with identifiable tan ectocervix on one side. The specimen is radially sectioned to reveal tan-brown cut surfaces. Unoriented quadrant is submitted per cassette A 1-A 4.

specimens.microscopic_description: The overall morphological findings show features consistent with cautery and reactive changes in block A2. The focus of cautery artifact is difficult to evaluate morphologically, so immunohistochemical stains (IHC; single antibody procedures with adequate controls) for Ki-67 and p16 were performed; the immunostain for p16 shows no block-like staining, and for Ki-67 shows no increase in mitotic activity (with mitoses largely confined to the basal layer of the squamous epithelium), confirming the morphological impression.
specimens.additional_notes: Ink code Orange-endocervical canal margin Blue-stroma. 46/F with high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion (HSIL, CIN II) and + high risk HPV

specimens.label: UTERUS, UTERUS AND TUBES, SUPRACERVICAL HYSTERECTOMY WITH BILATERAL SALPINGECTOMY
diagnosis: Uterus with exaggerated placental site
Endometrium with decidual changes
Unremarkable serosa
Bilateral unremarkable fallopian tubes

gross_description.label: Specimen #1 is received in formalin labeled with the patient's name, medical record number, \
gross_description.description: a supracervical tan-pink uterine fundus (8.6 x 7.2 x 4.5 cm, 232 grams) with attached bilateral fimbriated fallopian tubes (right: 9.7 x 0.8 x 0.8 cm, left: 9.9 x 0.8 x 0.6 cm). The uterine fundus serosal surface is tan-pink and smooth. The cervical canal resection margin is markedly dilated (3.4 cm in diameter) with adhered clotted blood. The cervical resection margin is inked blue and the uterine fundus is bivalved to reveal an endometrial cavity (6.5 x 4.0 cm) with a marked amount of adhered clotted blood and red-brown soft tissue ranging from 0.2 to 0.7 cm thick. Both halves are serially sectioned to reveal a myometrium ranging from 1.5 to 2.0 cm with tightly adhered clotted blood and probable decidua. The bilateral fallopian tubes are serially sectioned to reveal tan lumen.

specimens.microscopic_description: The sections of uterus show endometrium with progestational changes. In on area the walll of the uterus is infiltrated by intermediate trophoblasts and multinucleated trophoblasts. The trophoblasts infiltrate between bundles of smooth muscle in cords, nest and individual cells up to 7 mm in depth. The trophoblast react strongly to cytokeratin and weakly to HCG.
specimens.additional_notes: Exaggerated placental sites have been associated with emergency hysterectomies and abortions. Pre-op diagnosis: Abortion with septic shock [O03.87, R65.21] Hemorrhage [R58]

gross_description.description: a tan-pink uterus (5.4 x 9.2 x 2.1 cm, 190 g) with attached bilateral fimbriated fallopian tubes (left: 4.8 x 0.8 x 0.3 cm, right: 5.3 x 0.7 x 0.3 cm), and attached bilateral ovaries (left: 3.2 x 2.2 x 0.6 cm, right: 2.5 x 2.0 x 0.4 cm). There is an intact fluid filled cyst (2.0 x 1. 5 cm) present on the left ovary. The uterine fundus serosal surface is irregular, hard, and nodular. The ectocervix is not patent and is covered by fold of vaginal mucosa (4.0 x 3.5 cm). The specimen is bivalved to reveal an endocervical canal 2.1 cm in length. The endocervical canal stroma is tan- white. The endometrial cavity is 2.5 x 2.2 and is lined by tan- white 0.3 cm thick endometrium. The myometrium thickness is 1.1-2.5 cm. Multiple tan- pink to tan- white whorled, and calcified subserosal and intramural nodules ranging from 0.8 to 3.3 cm are identified. The bilateral fallopian tubes are serially sectioned to reveal tan- brown tissue with lumens. The bilateral ovaries are serially sectioned to reveal tan-white, variegated cut surfaces with identifiable corpora albicans. On sectioning the left ovary with fluid filled cyst, clear fluid is released and thickness of the cyst is 0.2 cm.

specimens.additional_notes: Comment: Immunostain with appropriate control for p16 performed on 2 separate blocks is positive. The ectocervix shows scarring and it is difficult to determine whether the dysplasia involves the ectocervix or proximal vagina. Ink code: Blue: Anterior vaginal fold; Black: Posterior vaginal fold

gross_description.label: A. Uterus. Specimen A is received in formalin labeled with patient's name, medical record number, \
gross_description.description: a tan uterus (9.4 x 6.5 x 5.1 cm, 126 g) with attached bilateral fimbriated fallopian tubes (right: 6.1 x 0.8 x 0.4 cm, left: 7.1 x 0.7 x 0.3 cm) and attached bilateral ovaries (right: 3.5 x 2.6 x 1.5 cm, left: 3.6 x 2.6 x 1.8 cm). The uterine fundus serosal surface is tan-pink and smooth. The ectocervix (3.7 x 2.3 cm) is tan-pink with an eccentrically placed slit-like os (1.5 cm in diameter). The uterus is bivalved to reveal an endocervical canal (3.1 cm in length), which is slightly dilated with herringbone architecture. A smooth-walled cyst (0.2 cm) is present within the cervical stroma, filled with gelatinous material. The endometrial cavity (3.9 x 2.7 cm thick) is scantly hemorrhagic. The myometrium, ranging from 0.9-2.0 cm in thickness, is tan-pink and contains no nodules. The bilateral fallopian tubes are serially sectioned to reveal tan lumens. The bilateral ovaries are sectioned to reveal multiple smooth-walled cysts (ranging from 0.3-0.5 cm).

specimens.additional_notes: Placental site nodule [D39.2] Abnormal uterine bleeding (AUB) [N93.9] Indication for Surgery: Placental site nodule AUB BMI 40 Endometrial thickness 1.79. ENDOMETRIUM, DILATION & CURETTAGE: Proliferative endometrium with disordered proliferative pattern and placental site nodule, no hyperplasia or malignancy identified. Electronically signed by Shenoy, Veena, MD on 10/24/2023 at 1409

gross_description.label: Specimen A is received in formalin labeled with the patient's name, medical record number, \
gross_description.description: a small tan-pink uterus (6.5 x 3.9 x 2.2 cm, 32 g) with a smooth serosal surface. The remaining ectocervical mucosa (1.3 x 1.1 cm) is focally hemorrhagic and diffusely ragged. The specimen is bivalved to reveal an endocervical canal (2.7 cm in length) with herringbone architecture. The endometrial cavity (1.9 x 1.2 x 0.1 cm) is tan-pink and scantly hemorrhagic. The myometrium ranging from 0.9-1.2 cm in thickness is tan-pink and contains a single tan-white whorled nodule (0.9 x 0.7 x 0.7 cm) on the left lateral aspect. Separately in the container are 2 segments of fimbriated fallopian tubes (2.5 x 1.1 x 1.0 cm, 3.5 x 0.9 x 0.9 cm) and 2 separate segments of non fimbriated fallopian tubes (2.6 x 0.5 x 0.4 cm, 3.2 x 0.4 x 0.4 cm) which are sectioned to reveal tan lumens.
